lines.content: This is a greenfield project by Eyu Gong Yi for CS2103. It is a Chat bot program.
* The {@code Main} class is the entry point for the Diomon application, which manages a task list.
* It handles user input, interacts with the storage to save and load tasks, and executes commands.
* Prints a greeting message when the application starts.
* The main loop of the application.
* It loads tasks from storage, listens for user input, executes commands, and saves tasks before exiting.
* The main method to start the Diomon application.
* @param args Command-line arguments (not used in this application).
* The {@code Commands} class represents a collection of commands that can be executed
* in a task management application. Commands include actions like adding tasks,
* marking tasks as done or undone, deleting tasks, and more. The class also provides
* support for handling user inputs and running the appropriate command based on the input.
* Initializes a new {@code Commands} object with the exit flag set to false.
* Checks if the program should exit.
* @return {@code true} if the exit flag is set, {@code false} otherwise.
* Checks and returns the command type based on the user's input string.
* @param command The input string representing the command.
* @throws RuntimeException if the command is not recognized.
* Executes the given command based on its type and input.
* @param input The input associated with the command.
* @param taskList The task list to operate on.
* @throws RuntimeException if the command is missing an argument or not implemented.
public void runCommand(Types t, String input, TaskList taskList) {
throw new RuntimeException("Missing argument/ Function not implemented");
throw new RuntimeException("Unknown argument/ Function not implemented yet");

* @param taskList The task list to operate on.

* The {@code Deadline} class represents a task with a specific deadline.
* It extends the {@link Task} class, adding the ability to track a due date.
* Each Deadline task has a description and a due date.
* Constructs a new {@code Deadline} task with the given description and deadline.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param deadline The due date of the task.
* Constructs a new {@code Deadline} task with the given completion status,
* @param complete {@code true} if the task is completed, {@code false} otherwise.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param deadline The due date of the task.
public Deadline(boolean complete, String description, LocalDate deadline) {
* Returns the icon representing the task type ("D" for Deadline).
* @return A string representing the task type icon.
* Returns a string representation of the {@code Deadline} task, including
* the description and formatted deadline information.
* @return A string representing the {@code Deadline} task.
* Returns a string representation of the {@code Deadline} task formatted for
* storage, which includes the type, status, description, and formatted deadline.
* Checks whether this {@code Deadline} task is equal to another object.
* Two {@code Deadline} tasks are considered equal if they have the same deadline,
* @param other The object to compare to.
* @return {@code true} if the tasks are equal, {@code false} otherwise.
* The {@code Event} class represents a task that occurs over a specific date range.
* It extends the {@link Task} class and includes a start date ("from") and an end date ("to").
* Constructs a new {@code Event} task with the given description, start date, and end date.
* @param task The description of the event.
* @param from The start date of the event.
* @param to The end date of the event.
public Event(String task, LocalDate from, LocalDate to) {
* Constructs a new {@code Event} task with the given completion status, description,
* @param complete {@code true} if the event is completed, {@code false} otherwise.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from The start date of the event.
* @param to The end date of the event.
public Event(boolean complete, String description, LocalDate from, LocalDate to) {
* Returns the icon representing the task type ("E" for Event).
* @return A string representing the task type icon.
* Returns a string representation of the {@code Event} task, including
* the description and formatted date range.
* @return A string representing the {@code Event} task.
return super.description + String.format(" (From: %s To: %s)", this.from.format(Parser.DATEFORMATTER), this.to.format(Parser.DATEFORMATTER));
* Returns a string representation of the {@code Event} task formatted for storage,
* which includes the type, status, description, and formatted start and end dates.
return String.format("%s|%s|%s|%s|%s", getTypeIcon(), getStatusIcon(),this.description, this.from.format(Parser.DATEFORMATTER), this.to.format(Parser.DATEFORMATTER));
* Checks whether this {@code Event} task is equal to another object.
* Two {@code Event} tasks are considered equal if they have the same start date,
* end date, completion status, and description.
* @param other The object to compare to.
* @return {@code true} if the tasks are equal, {@code false} otherwise.
return temp.from.equals(from) && temp.to.equals(to) && temp.completed == completed && temp.description.equals(description);
* The {@code Parser} class provides methods to parse stored task data
* into {@link Task} objects and to format dates according to the application's
* The {@code DateTimeFormatter} used to format and parse dates
* Parses a string of stored task data and returns the corresponding {@link Task} object.
* The task type is determined by the type icon at the beginning of the string.
* @param data The stored task data, formatted as a string with fields separated by the "|" symbol.
* @throws RuntimeException If the task type is unrecognized or the data is invalid.
* Parses stored data for a {@link Todo} task.
* @param dataArr An array of strings representing the stored fields for the todo task.
* @throws RuntimeException If the completion status is invalid or the data format is incorrect.
throw new RuntimeException("CompletionStatus seem to be wrong");
throw new RuntimeException("Error loading todo task, data stored is wrong");
* Parses stored data for a {@link Deadline} task.
* @param dataArr An array of strings representing the stored fields for the deadline task.
* @throws RuntimeException If the completion status is invalid or the data format is incorrect.
throw new RuntimeException("CompletionStatus seem to be wrong");
throw new RuntimeException("Error loading deadline task, data stored is wrong");
* Parses stored data for an {@link Event} task.
* @param dataArr An array of strings representing the stored fields for the event task.
* @throws RuntimeException If the completion status is invalid or the data format is incorrect.
throw new RuntimeException("CompletionStatus seem to be wrong");
throw new RuntimeException("Error loading event task, data stored is wrong");
* Checks whether the stored status is valid (either complete or incomplete).
* @param status The stored status string to be checked.
* @return {@code true} if the status is invalid, {@code false} if valid.
* The {@code Storage} class is responsible for handling the saving and loading
* of task data to and from a file. It ensures that task data is persisted
* Constructs a {@code Storage} object with the specified file path.
* If the file does not exist, it creates the necessary directories and file.
* @param filePath The path of the file where tasks will be stored.
* Loads tasks from the file specified by {@code filePath}.
* Each line in the file is expected to represent a task, which is parsed using {@link Parser#loadTask(String)}.
* @return An array of {@link Task} objects loaded from the file.
* If the file is not found or empty, an empty array is returned.
* Creates the necessary directories and file if they do not already exist.
* This method is called during the initialization of {@code Storage} to ensure
* the storage file is ready for use.
System.out.println("Something went wrong with data file");
* Saves the given task data to the file specified by {@code filePath}.
* The entire contents of the file are replaced by the given string.
* @param data The task data to save to the file, formatted as a single string.
* The {@code Task} class represents a generic task with a description and completion status.
* It serves as a base class for more specific tasks like {@link Todo}, {@link Event}, and {@link Deadline}.
* Enum representing the types of tasks supported.
* Constructs a {@code Task} with the given description. By default, the task is not completed.
* @param task The description of the task.
* Constructs a {@code Task} with the given completion status and description.
* @param complete     Whether the task is completed or not.
* @param description  The description of the task.
* Creates a new task based on the provided type and description.
* Parses the input for more complex task types like {@link Deadline} and {@link Event}.
* @param task The description of the task.
* @param type The type of task to create (TODO, DEADLINE, or EVENT).
* @return A new {@code Task}, {@code Todo}, {@code Event}, or {@code Deadline} object depending on the type.
* @throws RuntimeException If the task format is invalid for {@link Event} or {@link Deadline}.
public static Task of(String task, TaskType type) {
* Marks the task as not completed.
* Gets the status icon of the task, which is "X" if completed and a blank space otherwise.
* @return The status icon of the task.
* Gets the type icon of the task. This can be overridden by subclasses to provide specific task types.
* @return The type icon of the task (defaults to a blank space).
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* Converts the task into a format suitable for storage in a file.
* @return A string formatted for storage, representing the type, status, and description of the task.
* Compares the current task with another object for equality. Two tasks are considered equal if
* their descriptions and completion statuses are the same.
* @param other The object to compare with.
* @return {@code true} if the tasks are equal, otherwise {@code false}.
* The {@code TaskList} class manages a collection of {@link Task} objects.
* It provides methods for adding, removing, marking, and unmarking tasks.
* It also allows conversion of tasks to string representations suitable for display and storage.
* Constructs a {@code TaskList} with the given tasks.
* @param args One or more {@code Task} objects to initialize the list with.
* Adds a task to the list.
* @param t The task to be added.
* Removes a task from the list based on its index.
* @param i The index of the task to be removed.
* Retrieves a task from the list based on its index.
* @param i The index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* Performs a fuzzy search on the tasks in the list by checking if each task's description contains the given input string.
* Returns a {@link TaskList} containing all tasks that match the input.
* @param input The string to search for in the task descriptions.
* @return A {@link TaskList} containing tasks whose descriptions contain the input string.
* Marks the task at the specified index as completed.
* @param i The index of the task to be marked as completed.
* Marks the task at the specified index as not completed.
* @param i The index of the task to be marked as incomplete.
* Returns a string representation of the task list for display.
* Each task is numbered and shows its type icon, status icon, and description.
* @return A string containing all tasks in a human-readable format.
temp = temp.concat(String.format("%d-> [%s][%s] %s\n", i + 1, t.getTypeIcon(), t.getStatusIcon(), t));
* Converts the task list to a string representation suitable for storage.
* Each task is formatted as a string and separated by a newline.
* @return A string containing all tasks formatted for storage.
* The {@code Todo} class represents a task that has no specific date or deadline.
* It is a subclass of {@link Task}, and includes specific functionality related to "Todo" tasks.
* Constructs a new {@code Todo} task with the given description.
* The task is initially marked as incomplete.
* @param task The description of the task.
* Constructs a new {@code Todo} task with the given completion status and description.
* @param complete    Whether the task is completed or not.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the type icon representing a "Todo" task.
* @return The type icon for "Todo", which is "T".
* Returns a string representation of the {@code Todo} task formatted for storage.
* The format includes the type icon, the status icon (completed or not), and the description.
* Compares this {@code Todo} task with another object for equality.
* Two {@code Todo} tasks are considered equal if they have the same completion status and description.
* @param other The object to compare with.
* @return {@code true} if the tasks are equal, {@code false} otherwise.
RuntimeException e = assertThrows(RuntimeException.class, () -> new Commands().runCommand(Commands.Types.LIST, "", new TaskList()));
assertEquals("Unknown argument/ Function not implemented yet", e.getMessage());
RuntimeException e = assertThrows(RuntimeException.class, () -> new Commands().runCommand(Commands.Types.TODO, null, new TaskList()));
assertEquals("Missing argument/ Function not implemented", e.getMessage());
TaskList taskList = new TaskList(new Task[] {new Todo("weee")});
TaskList taskList = new TaskList(new Task[] {new Todo(false, "weee")});
TaskList taskList = new TaskList(new Task[] {new Todo(true, "weee")});
TaskList taskList = new TaskList(new Task[] {new Todo(true, "weee")});
assertEquals("Text '01-09-202' could not be parsed at index 6",e.getMessage());
assertEquals("Error loading deadline task, data stored is wrong",e.getMessage());
assertEquals("Text '02-9-2024' could not be parsed at index 3",e.getMessage());
assertEquals("Error loading event task, data stored is wrong",e.getMessage());
